content: The health, wealth and career or HWC segment generated revenue growth of 5% on an organic and constant currency basis compared to the fourth quarter of last year. Excluding the impact of book of business activity, HWCâs operating margin was 39% compared to 37.6% in the prior year fourth quarter. In the Insurance Consulting and Technology business, revenue was up 17% over the prior year fourth quarter, benefiting from the timing of software sales, which had originally been expected earlier in the year as well as increased advisory work. Excluding the impact of book of business activity, R&Bâs operating margin was 27.6% for the quarter compared to 28.3% in the prior year fourth quarter. Your line is open. Your line is open.
